title: Stormclouds

intro.speaker: Begnion
intro.line: General Levail! How did it go?

intro.speaker: Levail
intro.line: It was no use. No one would even listen to me. It makes my heart heavy. The nobles are too busy competing with one another for rewards and status to realize the danger to their lands. Begnion: Rewards? Are they crazy? The sub-humans are at their doors, and all they care about is some reward?!

intro.speaker: Levail
intro.line: They only listen to each other. No one wants to listen to me.

intro.speaker: Begnion
intro.line: General Levail, how are we going to survive this?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: We'll leave the troops on the left to you beorc. Sound good?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Fine by me. We'll teach these nobles a thing or two.

conversation.speaker: Heather
conversation.line: So you’re Ilyana? That’s such a cute and delicate name! I’d never have guessed there’d be such a pretty girl around all these laguz! What a lucky day!

conversation.speaker: Ilyana
conversation.line: Sigh…

conversation.speaker: Heather
conversation.line: Is something wrong, Ilyana? Are you feeling sick? You look weak.

conversation.speaker: Ilyana
conversation.line: I’m… so hungry…

conversation.speaker: Heather
conversation.line: Oh, no! That’s no good. Hold on. I’ll bring some food for you right away.

conversation.speaker: Ilyana
conversation.line: Really? Oh, that would be wonderful…

conversation.speaker: Heather
conversation.line: Oh, look at that smile! So, what do you like?

conversation.speaker: Ilyana
conversation.line: Something delicious. I don’t particularly care what it is. I just want loads of it.

conversation.speaker: Heather
conversation.line: Um, all right. I guess that means you eat pretty much anything? I’ll go find somoe dupe who thinks I’m cute, and I’ll con him into cooking something! You stay put!

conversation.speaker: Ilyana
conversation.line: How interesting… Heather… Her name is Heather. I’ll have to remember her name. She likes to feed me.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You still eating everything in sight?

conversation.speaker: Ilyana
conversation.line: Ah… Hello, Ike. I haven’t seen you in a long time.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Glad to see you remember me.

conversation.speaker: Ilyana
conversation.line: Of course. I remember all of the mercenaries. Well, most of you, anyway. Oscar prepares such delicious meals. I remember that well enough. Oh, I can’t wait to eat his food again.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Well, I can see you haven’t changed a bit.

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: Oh… It’s like a dream come true. My hero, standing right in front of me. Somebody pinch me.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Hey, if you don’t let go of my hand, I can’t pay you for anything.

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: No! My darling… Let us not spoil our time together with talk of money! Speak sweetly to me, handsome.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Listen, lady. This is a shop, and I’m a customer. What’s so sweet about that?

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: Oh, such cold words… My hero plays hard to get! You’re only making me more interested.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Will you let go of my hand? Please?

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: Then tell me I’m beautiful! Tell me I’m more beautiful than any woman in this camp!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: …And then you’ll let go of my hand?

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: Of course. I’ll even give you everything you want for free.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Oh! All right, then…
No, Ike! Don’t say another word!

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: That voice! It’s--

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: C’mon, Soren. She’s going to give us everything! For free!

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: Nothing in life is free, Ike. Suppose you said what she asked you to say, hmm? What then? You’d hear it all over the camp. In nearby villages. Eventually, the entire country would be saying it! "Ike, hero of the Mad King’s War, is in love with Aimee the shopgirl." Rumors can quickly spin out of control.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Come off it. You’re exaggerating.

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: Ooh, don’t be so sure. With my network of merchants, I’ll spread the word to the four corners of Tellius! Within half a year, everyone will know! Then you will be mine forever, Ike! You’ll have no choice at all!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Man, you go right for the neck, don’t you? All right, Soren. She’s all yours.

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: Yes, sir. What I do now, I do for the good of the company.

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: No, Ike! Don’t go! Don’t do this to me!

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: Well, now. Shall we get on with our business? You’re looking more beautiful than ever, Miss Aimee. A true delight for the eyes.

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: Ooo… Now you’re talking, you little lady-killer!

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: I know you won’t discount the goods to nothing, since it’s coming from me. So… How about you cut your prices down by three-quarters?

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: Ooh… Decisions, decisions.

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: You’re a diamond, and other beorc only glass beads, Miss Aimee. I’ll buy more than enough to justify the discount.

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: Half price, maybe.

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: A touch less than three-quarters, then. What do you say, rose of Tellius? O goddess of desire?

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: All right, you win! Just this time, mind you. Take this.

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: Ah, a Silver Card. I can buy everything for half price at all of the shops?

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: That’s right. Remember what I said, though. It’s a limited-time deal. I’ll have to take it away soon. Oh, and while you own this card, you won’t be able to sell your weapons as raw material. Got that?

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: Understood, Miss Aimee. Stay beautiful.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: The enemy general is down! Let the fleeing soldiers go. Everyone, fall back!

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Hey. You're done, too? That was fast.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Yeah, it was easy work. They retreated pretty quickly.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Their soldiers were well equipped and well trained, but their commanders were terrible.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: That's lucky for us, I suppose. Things seem to be working out pretty well so far. Unless they bring in a real commander, it's only a matter of time before they wave a white flag.

end.speaker: Gallia
end.line: E-enemies to the south! It's the Central Army!

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: What?!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Tibarn failed in stalling them... Does that mean he's...dead?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Doubtful. I don't think there was even a battle. The Central Army has arrived too quickly.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Grrrr... We only know one thing for sure. The enemy now has the advantage.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: There are still enemies to the north. This is quickly turning into our worst-case scenario.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Skrimir, we must retreat. We're in serious trouble here.

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: Show my back to beorc? Never! We will fight on like the Gallians we are!

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Skrimir, listen to me! We must retreat. This is the Central Army we're talking about!

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: Ah, finally! Finally, we get to fight the Begnion Central Army! I have been waiting for this!

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: I can see you won't change your mind, Skrimir. All right, if it has to come to this...

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: Are you joking? You can't beat me, Ranulf. You know that.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: I can't let you or our men die in vain. It's my job to keep you from doing anything that stupid. If I have to knock you out to keep you out of this battle, then that's what I'll do.

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: Fine. Try.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Ike! Stop them!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: No. They need to do this.

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: Do not worry about him. I might have broken some bones, but he will heal quickly.

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: My soldiers! We are leaving! Head back to base camp!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: General Skrimir...

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: We will return and regroup. It pains me, but we must. Damn it, Ranulf... He...got my leg.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: But you're still willing to carry him?

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: If he doesn't rest and heal, all his little chores fall on me. I can't have that.

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: Reporting, sir! The Laguz Alliance is retreating!

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: So, the enemy does not persist with the situation turns against them. I'm impressed. They're flexible and adapt quickly to a changing environment.

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: Shall we pursue them?

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: No, first we will join our allies to the north. I hear they've taken heavy losses.

end.speaker: Levail
end.line: General Zelgius. It's an honor to meet you.

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: General Levail of Duke Gaddos's northern force, is it? Are you in command here?

end.speaker: Levail
end.line: No, not I. Rather... The northern force lacks any order. We do not have a central commander to direct us in battle.

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: So, each force was fighting the enemy on its own?

end.speaker: Levail
end.line: Quite so. Taking orders from others is beneath the nobles, I suppose.

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: How pitiful.

end.speaker: Levail
end.line: A sad state of affairs, yes. But now that you are here, General, the situation will be rectified.

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: Yes, one can hope.

end.speaker: Levail
end.line: ...So, are the rumors true?

end.speaker: Levail
end.line: I've heard that power in Begnion has been split between the apostle and the senators.

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: True, they do not agree on how to deal with the Laguz Alliance. However...

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: As long as there are enemies who threaten the empire, we shall fight. That is our duty, is it not?

end.speaker: Levail
end.line: ...Indeed.

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: Then do not trouble your mind with politics. Let the nobles worry about their games. We should focus on this war.

narration: The apostle Sanaki, empress of the Begnion Empire, does not wish war with the laguz and searches feverishly for a peaceful resolution. However, many imperial senators see the war not only as a means to expand their own influence but also as a convenient opportunity to exterminate the laguz once and for all. These ambitious senators meet with Vice-Minister Lekain and vigorously advocate a full-scale war.
Having seen their homeland invaded, Begnion citizens desiring peace are now few and far between. Against the apostle's wishes, Begnion's army is now fully committed to the war with the laguz.
Zelgius easily escapes the talons of the bird tribes meant to delay him and the Central Army. He arrives at the Sestohl Plains to reinforce his weakened allies.

The laguz forces are surprised by the sudden appearance of this new enemy and seek counsel from Ranulf of Gallia. Ranulf orders a retreat with all speed, thus avoiding a full-on engagement with the Central Army.

General Zelgius chooses not to pursue the fleeing Gallian army. Instead, he orders his army to hold position on the eastern banks of the Ribahn. Divided by the river, the two armies are deadlocked, able to do little more than glare at one another in hatred.
